intro: Aristida spegazzinii var. pallescens, commonly known as the pale aristida, is a grass species native to arid and semi-arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale to whitish flowers, which are typical of the grass family Poaceae. It is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep root systems that help it endure periods of drought. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and is used in some regions for forage or erosion control.
